title: 109_hr5574
content: The Act titled "Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2006" establishes a program of payments to children's hospitals with graduate medical education programs. The Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2006 amends Section 340E of the Public Health Service Act for fiscal years 2007 through 2011, increasing funding to $110,000,000 annually. The Children's Hospital GME Support Reauthorization Act of 2006 amends Section 340E of the Public Health Service Act for fiscal years 2007 through 2011, increasing funding to $220,000,000 annually. Subsection (b) of section 340E is also amended to include a reduction in payments for failure to file annual reports. The funding allocation to a children's hospital may be reduced by 25 percent if the Secretary determines certain conditions are met. The hospital may face a 25 percent funding reduction if it fails to provide the required report to the Secretary. Before imposing a reduction on a hospital for failing to provide required information, the Secretary must notify the hospital and give them 30 days to submit the missing information. If the hospital complies within the given period, no reduction will be imposed. The report for a children's hospital for a fiscal year must include information on the types of resident training programs provided, the number of training positions available for residents, and the specific medical and non-medical subspecialties offered. The hospital report must include details on the number of positions recruited and filled, types of training provided for residents related to underserved populations, and changes in residency training made during the academic year. Changes in curricula, training experiences, and types of training programs, as well as benefits resulting from these changes, are required to be reported in the hospital report. Additionally, changes in training residents to measure and improve the quality and safety of patient care should also be included. The hospital report must include the numbers of residents who completed their residency training and care for children within the service area or state. Residents in various training programs sponsored by the hospital or other entities are included. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress summarizing information, describing program results, and making recommendations for improvements. Technical amendments are made to Section 340E of the Public Health Service Act. In subsection (c)(2)(E)(ii), the text is amended by removing "described in subparagraph (C)(ii)" and replacing it with "applied under section 1886(d)(3)(E) of the Social Security Act for discharges occurring during the preceding fiscal year". Subsection (e)(2) has the first sentence removed, and in subsection (e)(3), "made to pay" is changed to "made and pay".
